speaker: DRIVER
line: Mr. Simon? Are you ready?

speaker: MAN
line: Yeah.

speaker: GUARD
line: Excuse me, Warden. It's 5:00, sir.

speaker: WARDEN
line: How's Neech?

speaker: GUARD
line: He's still in with his wife.

speaker: WARDEN
line: No, I mean how is he? How's he doing?

speaker: GUARD
line: Well, he won't eat his meal and he won't see the chaplain. Told him to get the hell out.

speaker: WARDEN
line: What about the hired man?

speaker: GUARD
line: He's traveling.

speaker: WARDEN
line: All right. Let's get Neech prepped.

speaker: GUARD
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: WARDEN
line: If God can't save his sorry ass, neither can I.

speaker: ROQUE
line: Time's up, Neech! 2,000 volts, man. You ain't never coming back, you freak.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: It's just like I've always told you. I swear on my life, Neech.

speaker: GUARD
line: Time to go.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: I ain't ever going to love another man. You hear me? I won't. I won't betray our love - ever.

speaker: GUARD
line: Time, Neech. Time to go.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: That phone call's gonna come, and the governor is gonna come through.

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: Got to go now.

speaker: WARDEN
line: We've got a hood if you want it. It's your option.

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: No.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Is there anything you want to say, Neech? Last words?

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: Yeah. I've been here 11 years, 56 days and now you're gonna murder me. The Lord says thou shall be merciful and just. I know no mercy. Allah says the spirit shall rise again and be reborn into this life...

speaker: WARDEN
line: You should begin, Father.

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: ... The soul shall be recast born unto new flesh...

speaker: FATHER
line: "The Lord is my shepherd..."

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: ... I will return to avenge all the petty tyranny and the cruelty I have suffered. I will be recast, reincarnated, reunion of spirit and flesh.

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: ... Mark my words. Five men will die. Five men will go down! This will be my justice! This will be my law! This will be my capital punishment, and no stay of execution will be granted...

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: ... for there is no prejudice, no evidence to be admitted... no lawyer...

speaker: WARDEN
line: Fry him.

speaker: NEECH MANLEY
line: ... who did not perform his job. These men will die righteous deaths!

speaker: MULDER
line: Napoleon "Neech" Manley. He was convicted in 1984 for double murder in the holdup of a Florida liquor store. The actual gunman was killed in the pursuit. Manley was driving the getaway car and got sentenced to death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was put to death in the electric chair three days ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, he'd been to the chair twice before but the governor had granted him last-minute stays.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Third time's a charm. What's your interest in this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, Manley was interesting. He was well-read, charismatic. He became a writer, a kind of prison philosopher. A week before his execution, word went through the prison that Neech said he was gonna be reincarnated. He was gonna come back from the dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, reincarnation has always been popular on death row for obvious reasons.

speaker: MULDER
line: Apparently, this was more than just a dying man's hope against hope.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: MULDER
line: Manley didn't just claim that he was gonna come back but that he was gonna take vengeance on five men who had mistreated him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yesterday, a death row guard was found dead inside the cell that Manley had occupied those 11 years. His death cannot be explained.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Has a cause of death been determined?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Suffocation, near as we can tell. Somebody must have snuffed him with a pillow.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea how one of your guards could get murdered in an empty cell like this?

speaker: WARDEN
line: No. It's not supposed to happen, not with all the precautions that we're taking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I see the guards here wear panic devices. Was the victim's activated?

speaker: WARDEN
line: No. Apparently he never touched it.

speaker: MULDER
line: According to our reports, there were threats this might happen.

speaker: WARDEN
line: There's always threats of violence in here. Prison's nothing but a police state, basically.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you give any credence to Neech Manley's claims that he was gonna come back and take revenge?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Neech Manley... a smart man, very smart man. In fact, if he'd stayed outside I would have figured him for a Nobel Prize. But he made a mistake and paid for it with his life. Now, you take a man of that intelligence, you put him inside for 10 or 11 years - you're gonna have to pay for it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Well, there's nothing but bitterness and resentment in here seven days a week, 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. It gets honed to a real fine point.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you're saying that Manley planned this and is carrying it out with the help of someone else.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Elaborate as Shakespeare. Now, if you want to see the victim's body...

speaker: FOURNIER
line: Visitors coming through. Woman on the block.

speaker: WARDEN
line: We're holding the corpse until the state pathologist comes down this afternoon and conducts the official autopsy. That information should help us solve the murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did Manley have many friends among the prisoners?

speaker: WARDEN
line: A man has to have friends in prison to keep an eye on his enemies. Mostly, people were just afraid of him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Warden?

speaker: WARDEN
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The body. I think you should take a look. I suggest you get it into refrigeration or you're not gonna have anything left to autopsy.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Oh, God.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've been told you believe Neech Manley's claims.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: It's not a matter of how or if he's coming back. The question is, when... is he coming back again?

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you saying, Speranza? You believe Manley killed that guard?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Well how else would you explain it?

speaker: MULDER
line: A prisoner waits for an opportunity...

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Hey, look around. We ain't got but an opportunity to itchy-scratchy outside our cells.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but you've got prisoners on work detail. Trustees - a man slips away.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Oh, this is "Q" block, death row. Don't nobody come in and out here without a guard watching and lately, you got double that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: 'Cause everybody's afraid of what they say can't be true. Neech is back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Reincarnated.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Well, he would have called it "transmigration of the soul."

speaker: MULDER
line: Into what form?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: You, me, this mattress - I don't know. He didn't specify, but he's back. I can feel it. The man was electric, you know what I'm saying? Pure energy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Would it be possible to see the cell where the guard was murdered?

speaker: FORNIER
line: I'll open it up for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any idea how he did it?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Like I said, the man...

speaker: FORNIER
line: Nothing's been touched. It's pretty much the way Neech left it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you know Neech Manley?

speaker: FORNIER
line: Oh, yeah. I knew him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What was he like?

speaker: FORNIER
line: Neech? Neech was so full of b.s., he couldn't stand it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is that?

speaker: FORNIER
line: He actually started to believe that crap he'd been preaching all those years, as if knowing all them religions made him some kind of god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who do you think killed the guard?

speaker: FORNIER
line: I don't know who killed him, but I damn well know who didn't kill him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you afraid at all?

speaker: FORNIER
line: Me? I just keep my ass covered and my eyes peeled. Same as always.

speaker: INMATE
line: Fornier! Hey, down here!

speaker: FORNIER
line: I'm gonna check back on your partner.

speaker: FORNIER
line: Everything okay in there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, fine.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Shh! I'm not gonna hurt you. I only want to talk to you, okay? I know who he's going to kill. There's a list. One of the cons has it. A man named Roque.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who are you?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: My name's Parmelly. I want to help you.

speaker: FORNIER
line: Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was just looking around.

speaker: FORNIER
line: Not a place for a woman to be doing that alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. I'm ready to go now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. I'll be right there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Guard!

speaker: MULDER
line: What's wrong, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm just ready to get out of here.

speaker: GUARD
line: I want every paint brush and putty knife to be accounted for, understand? Come on, gentlemen, move it.

speaker: INMATE
line: It's the guard. It's Fornier.

speaker: GUARD
line: Come on you guys. Break it up. Get back. I said get back.

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: I guess they haven't recovered the body yet so it's going to be difficult to establish an exact cause of death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What did your preliminary exam turn up?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Well, it looks like the head was severed just below the jawline with repeated stabbing blows from a putty knife. There were no other indications of trauma to the head.

speaker: SCULLY
line: From the eyewitness reports, there were already fly larvae infesting the flesh. That seems unusual considering the short time-of-death window.

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Not altogether. Here, let me show you this. Lucilia cuprina - better known as the green bottle fly. They can lay their eggs within a minute after death occurs, and they breed more rapidly in a hot, humid environment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In the anaerobic environment inside the paint can?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: On my autopsy on the first victim, the lungs were absolutely alive with infestation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hmmm. What was determined to be the cause of that death?

speaker: PATHOLOGIST
line: Best I can figure, given the lack of indicators, he was suffocated to death. Either that... or he drowned.

speaker: GUARD
line: You've got a visitor, Roque.

speaker: MULDER
line: I hear you have a list.

speaker: ROQUE
line: I prefer not to talk about it here. Not on the block.

speaker: MULDER
line: Guard?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: You's a dead man, Roque! You hear me?! I'm gonna peel that head like an onion! I'm gonna to break you off a big chunk! You hear me?! He ain't gonna tell you nothing but a bunch of lies! You talk, punk, I will make you my Maytag! He's alive!

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you come by this list you claim to have?

speaker: ROQUE
line: I heard Neech on the bars one night telling Speranza.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many names are on the list?

speaker: ROQUE
line: Five. Just like Neech said.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you knew those two guards were gonna be murdered?

speaker: ROQUE
line: I knew they were on the list, yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who do you think killed them?

speaker: ROQUE
line: I don't know. I just know who's on the list.

speaker: MULDER
line: You want to make some kind of deal, huh?

speaker: ROQUE
line: That's right. I want a transfer out of this hole.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? Are you on the list?

speaker: ROQUE
line: I ain't saying nothing. Not until I get my deal.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what if they don't give you what you want?

speaker: ROQUE
line: Then they're gonna to see the other three die.

speaker: WARDEN
line: I can't do it. I can't make that deal.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't have the authority?

speaker: WARDEN
line: No, it's not that. If I make that deal I might as well go into the deal-making business. Every con with half a brain would come up with a scheme like that.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what if it saves three lives? Isn't that a deal worth making?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Look, my job is about controlling anarchy. I don't run this prison, I just patrol it. Basically, it's war in here. We have freedom. They don't. Anything these men want, somehow it finds its way in here. They want another prisoner dead somebody's gonna find a way to put a shiv in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These aren't prisoners. These are guards you've got being murdered.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Yes, and if I back down now, all I'll be doing is sending a message about the benefits of killing prison guards. There's a conspiracy at work here. I don't know who's behind it. But I am gonna crack it. That's my job.

speaker: WARDEN
line: What the hell? Guard! Guard! Get in here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess you'll be able to finish up that autopsy now, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He had quite a library.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Looks like Neech Manley knew his Bible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen to this. "I come in return to the beginning of the end to begin again the journey of souls... the godhead universal for whom there is no death only life eternal."

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's that from?

speaker: MULDER
line: Neech Manley, 1994. This stuff goes on for hundreds of pages. There's references to the Hindu Atman, Prarabdha, the Rosicrucians, Zoroastrianism. The man was obsessed with reincarnation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Being obsessed with it doesn't mean you can do it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless he knew something we don't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Like what? The secret password?

speaker: MULDER
line: Every major world religion encompasses the idea of life after death. That means millions, even billions of people believe in some kind of transmigration or rebirth of the soul.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, Mulder, that's not what I learned in catechism.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, even Christianity teaches about the resurrection and ascendancy of the heavenly body.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you honestly believe that Neech Manley came back from the dead to kill those two men?

speaker: MULDER
line: Is there another competing theory?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A very good one, and one much more believable.

speaker: MULDER
line: That this is a complex scheme, that the headless man planted behind the warden's desk is the work of a conspiracy of inmates.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or guards.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but imagine if it were true, Scully. Imagine if you could come back and take out five people who had caused you to suffer. Who would they be?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I only get five?

speaker: MULDER
line: I remembered your birthday this year, didn't I, Scully? Well, here's somebody we haven't talked to yet. She should know better than anybody else.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Manley?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: We're from the FBI. We'd like to ask you a few questions about your husband.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: I had this dream... had it many times. That they put Neech in that chair and they flipped the switch, but that he wouldn't die. They couldn't kill him. He's a powerful man. Very powerful man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he ever share his thoughts about dying with you?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Neech wasn't afraid to die.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Because of his beliefs?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Sometimes... see, I only got to have personal visiting days right before the execution dates. There was three in the last 11 years. But sometimes... I could feel the power of his beliefs right through that visiting glass.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think he's come back, don't you?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: You know... I think that if anyone could... it'd be Neech.

speaker: GUARD
line: Get up, Roque. Putting on the chains.

speaker: ROQUE
line: Hey, man... for what?

speaker: GUARD
line: The warden wants to talk to you.

speaker: GUARD
line: Other way.

speaker: ROQUE
line: Where are we going?

speaker: GUARD
line: This way.

speaker: ROQUE
line: Let go of my arm, I'm going! What you want with me, anyway? Stop pushing!

speaker: WARDEN
line: Hey, Roque. I want to talk to you about this list.

speaker: ROQUE
line: I ain't saying nothing.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Come on, Roque, you got a big mouth. What are you shutting up now for? Huh?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Who's on the list? Am I on the list, Roque? Am I on that list?! Is my name on that list?!

speaker: ROQUE
line: You're number five. How's it feel to be on death row, Warden?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you catch her body language?

speaker: MULDER
line: She was nervous, or scared.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Of what? That her husband's gonna keep his word?

speaker: MULDER
line: A lot could have happened in her life in those 11 years Neech was in prison. A lot probably did.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean she thinks she's on the list?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know, but I've been thinking a lot about that list, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully. We're on our way. That was the warden. There's been another death.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Roque. They found him beaten to death in the showers on death row.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Gotta go now.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: God. You scare me when you do that.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Why? You think it's him?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Wh-where are you going?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: I'm going to work.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Parm, I'm scared. You feel me? I'm shaking like a little kitten.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Hey. Now what are you scared of?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: What if somebody finds out? I-I mean, what if...

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Will you stop your worrying? Everything's gonna be all right. Hmm? He ain't coming back, Danielle. He ain't.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who found the body?

speaker: WARDEN
line: One of my guards.

speaker: MULDER
line: No one heard anything?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Nobody who should have. I'm ordering a lockdown of this facility until the situation is brought back under control. As far as I'm concerned, anyone who had contact with Neech Manley is a suspect.

speaker: MULDER
line: Warden?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: I warned you. That's three.

speaker: MULDER
line: Warden? Why Roque?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Neech hated Roque. They pretty near tried to kill each other once.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well then, why the other victims?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Neech probably hated them too.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did Neech have a history with the guards who died?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Neech had a small behavioral problem, about a year, a year and a half ago. Fornier and the other men had to, uh, discipline him.

speaker: MULDER
line: How badly was he beaten?

speaker: WARDEN
line: He took his licks.

speaker: MULDER
line: So there's a pattern here, a logic. All these men had a violent history with Neech. They all caused him to suffer physical pain.

speaker: WARDEN
line: What are you getting at?

speaker: MULDER
line: A lockdown may not solve your problem, warden.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Sure as hell'll put a lid on it.

speaker: MULDER
line: If it's a conspiracy among the inmates, but how many inmates could have put that body in your office? How many could have gotten access?

speaker: WARDEN
line: You're saying the guards are involved?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm saying that Roque may not be victim number three. Now, I need a name from you. I need the name of Neech's executioner.

speaker: WARDEN
line: It's confidential.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many men know it?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Three men, including me. We place an ad, pay him in cash. There's no written record.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, his life may be in danger.

speaker: WARDEN
line: There is no chance...

speaker: MULDER
line: Well look at it this way, warden. If I'm right, it'll reduce your list of suspects to four.

speaker: WARDEN
line: I said three men knew that name.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm counting Neech Manley.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mr. Simon? Perry Simon? Couple of days' worth of mail.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I told you, didn't I?

speaker: MULDER
line: You told me everything but what I need to know. Who else is on that list, John?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I can't tell you that.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's he doing it, John?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I really can't tell you.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're just gonna let those men die?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Ain't my call!

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, they're going to pin it on somebody! They're gonna pin it on you...

speaker: SPERANZA
line: They're gonna what? What are they going to do to me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Put you in solitary, one hour a week outside your cell, no contact with anyone. They say it can break a man.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I can't tell you, man.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're afraid of Neech?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I saw him.

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw Neech.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Standing outside my cell, big as life.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell me who else is on the list, John. Who's next?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I can't tell you who's on the list. But I can tell you, Roque wasn't on it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Roque's not on it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, can I have a minute?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've just been going over Neech's phone calls over the last two months. Over 30 of them were made to a man named Danny Charez - twice as many as to his own wife.

speaker: MULDER
line: And?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Charez has been here three times to see Speranza since the first murder. He could be working with him on the outside.

speaker: CHAREZ
line: Look, I've got nothing to hide.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay then, what's your business with John Speranza?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: I was trying to get Speranza a deal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of deal?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: Retrial maybe. Reopen the case. I got some connections with the government.

speaker: MULDER
line: What kind of connections?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: I used to be an attorney. Actually, I represented Neech Manley.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You were Neech Manley's defense lawyer?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: I was 26. I was court-appointed. I had no business on a death penalty case.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why help Speranza now?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: I heard about Neech's death list. Word gets around. And I know he blames me for him getting fried so I figured I got to try something.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think Speranza's got some sway with Neech?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: I'm just trying to save my ass. I've been to the Governor, Speranza, Neech's wife...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why Neech's wife?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: Maybe she's got some mojo with him too. I don't know. Anyway, I got run out of there by her crazy boyfriend.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She has a boyfriend?

speaker: CHAREZ
line: Works at the prison. Waving a freakin' gun in my face.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Hello, John.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: What do you want?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Oh, no, sit down, sit. I'm here to do you good.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: What you talking about?

speaker: WARDEN
line: I want to be your advocate. I'm gonna get them to look at your case again, pull a few strings in Tallahassee.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: And what do you want from me?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Just call off the dogs. That's all. What do you say? Scratch my back, I'll scratch yours.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: All right.

speaker: WARDEN
line: I'll have somebody from the Governor's office down here to see you by this weekend.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Where have you been?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Out.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Out. What do you mean, out?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: What's with you?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: You see who's sitting outside watching this house? You see that car out there? You know who that is? Huh? The stupid FBI. They came here tonight asking about you.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: About me?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Said they saw you waving a gun in some lawyer's face in my front yard.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: That's crazy!

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: I thought you said nobody knew about us. Now lookit, just lookit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A woman gets lonely... sometimes she can't wait around for a man to be reincarnated. I think we should notify the warden.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Is that the man?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's him. Parmelly.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Yeah, give me, uh, Vincent Parmelly's work sheet for the last week, will you please? Thank you. Now, you say you saw him with Neech's wife?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I hadn't reported it but that same guard also cornered me and made an overture for prisoner Roque.

speaker: WARDEN
line: He's tied in with Roque?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, does it make sense to you that Parmelly is Neech's assassin?

speaker: WARDEN
line: I don't know Parmelly that well. He's a transfer in from out of state. He's only been here six months.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, according to an attorney we spoke to, he had brandished a gun at the residence.

speaker: WARDEN
line: What attorney?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A man named Charez. You know him?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Everybody knows Danny Charez. He was found dead earlier this evening at his apartment.

speaker: MULDER
line: Murdered?

speaker: WARDEN
line: Suffocated to death, or so it seems.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he could be the fifth victim.

speaker: WARDEN
line: I think somebody ought to go out and arrest Vincent Parmelly.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Oh, my God. No...

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Neech?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: What the hell you doing?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: He's here.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Neech - I saw him.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Somebody's here, but it ain't Neech.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: They're coming here.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: It's you, isn't it?

speaker: PARMELLY
line: What?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: You're him.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: You're crazy, baby.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Put that gun away, Danielle. That's the police out there.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Agent Mulder. Please open the door.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: I should have known. I should have opened my eyes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Manley, we're federal agents. Open the door.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: The way you touched me...

speaker: MULDER
line: Danielle?

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: ... and the sound of your voice.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: Point that gun away, Danielle. I'm telling you - they're gonna put you away just like your old man.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: Don't you come near me.

speaker: PARMELLY
line: You're seeing ghosts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Manley, open the door.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She's got a gun on Parmelly. Center room, facing away.

speaker: MULDER
line: On a count...

speaker: MULDER
line: Drop your weapon!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Put it down! Put it down!

speaker: MULDER
line: Drop your weapon, Danielle. Let's get a paramedic in here.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: It was him. He came back.

speaker: MULDER
line: Forget it.

speaker: DANIELLE MANLEY
line: I swear it was him. It was Neech.

speaker: GUARD
line: No, go this...

speaker: SPERANZA
line: What you talking about?

speaker: GUARD
line: We're going this way. Somebody wants to talk to you.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: What kind of crap is this? Who wants to talk to me?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Well, the warden's office is that way.

speaker: GUARD
line: We're going down here.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Uh-uh. No.

speaker: GUARD
line: Why not.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Man, this is bull! I ain't going for it! What the hell is this, man? Why do you want to talk to me in the shower for anyway, huh? What the...

speaker: WARDEN
line: John. Hear about your friend Parmelly tonight?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: He's not my friend.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Oh, he's not your friend. Well, it doesn't matter any more anyway, does it, huh?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: You promised me a deal.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Yeah, well, that was when there was a deal to be made.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Who else was in on it, John?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I can tell you.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Tell me what?

speaker: SPERANZA
line: I can tell you what I know.

speaker: WARDEN
line: Well, tell me what you know.

speaker: SPERANZA
line: Neech's list... got one man left to die.

speaker: INMATES' VOICES
line: What's going on up there? Something's going on. Hey, leave him alone!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why are we stopping?

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, it just doesn't make sense.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: Laying it all on Parmelly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought we already went through this.

speaker: MULDER
line: It doesn't bother you that he was only on duty for one of the guards' murders or that he wasn't among the three men that knew the name of Neech's executioner?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then he was working with someone. They just haven't found out who.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, why would he come to you and try to get you the list?

speaker: SCULLY
line: To use fear as leverage for Roque's deal with the warden.

speaker: MULDER
line: But Neech hated Roque. If Parmelly was working with Neech, he wouldn't have done that, would he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know. Maybe Parmelly wasn't sticking with the original plan. I'm sure this shacking up with Neech's wife wasn't part of it either, or maybe Neech's wife killing Parmelly was part of the plan from the beginning so that he'd take the truth to the grave with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: I just don't see the motives. Do you? I don't think Parmelly killed anybody.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well then, who did? Neech Manley?

speaker: MULDER
line: Speranza and Neech's wife both said they saw him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's over, Mulder. Let's just go home.
